greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A289815(n) * A289816(n).
comment: Each number k > 0 appears 2^omega(k) times (where omega = A001221).
The number of distinct prime factors of a(n) equals the number of nonzero digits in the ternary representation of n.
link: Rémy Sigrist, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
program: def omega(n): return 0 if n==1 else len(primefactors(n))
print([a(n) for n in range(101)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Aug 02 2017
results.author: _Rémy Sigrist_, Jul 13 2017
